availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Felix G. Gregory (Caldwell County and Lyon County, Kentucky, laborer & Light Artillery CSA pvt, sgt, teamster)

body.p: Caldwell County and Lyon County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Gregory, Sr., and Mary Gregory. Resident of Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Laborer in Lyon County in 1860. Served in Captain R. Cobb's Company, Light Artillery (C.S.A.) as sergeant, private, and teamster from September 30, 1861, to April 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 326B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 681.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0074.
"Felix Gregory (1844-1876)," Find A Grave, Memorial #41691334, accessed December 8, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41691334.
